docs.abstract: The four-and-a-half-ton animal was separated from its herd in northeast India and carried downstream to Bangladesh in June.
docs.snippet: The four-and-a-half-ton animal was separated from its herd in northeast India and carried downstream to Bangladesh in June.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Plenty of back-and-forth intermingling happens along the 2,500-mile zigzag border shared by India and Bangladesh. But the Bangladeshis are having trouble returning a four-and-a-half-ton Indian visitor to its home.

headline.main: Torrential Rains Strand Wayward Indian Elephant in Bangladesh

docs.abstract: The men tied to the bloody restaurant siege in Dhaka, all in their late teens and early 20s, were products of Bangladesh’s elite.
docs.snippet: The men tied to the bloody restaurant siege in Dhaka, all in their late teens and early 20s, were products of Bangladesh’s elite.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Bangladesh’s capital city reeled in shock on Sunday as clues began to flood social media about the privileged backgrounds of the half-dozen attackers believed to have butchered 20 patrons of a restaurant during a bloody siege here late last week.

headline.main: After Slaughter, Bangladesh Reels at Revelations About Attackers
headline.print_headline: Attackers Linked to Bangladesh Restaurant Slaughter Had Privileged Lives

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

byline.original: By Julfikar Ali Manik and Geeta Anand

docs.abstract: The adult male elephant was swept away by floodwaters, sending him 900 miles downriver to Bangladesh, where villagers kept him from climbing ashore.
docs.snippet: The adult male elephant was swept away by floodwaters, sending him 900 miles downriver to Bangladesh, where villagers kept him from climbing ashore.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — A wild Indian elephant that attracted worldwide attention after being swept hundreds of miles down a flood-swollen river into Bangladesh died on Tuesday of a heart attack, Bangladeshi officials said.

headline.main: Stranded Indian Elephant Dies of Heart Attack, Ending a Wretched Journey
headline.print_headline: Elephant Caught in River Dies After Torturous Trip

docs.abstract: New research reveals how water has changed across the surface of the earth over the last 30 years.
docs.snippet: New research reveals how water has changed across the surface of the earth over the last 30 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: New research reveals how water has changed across the surface of the earth over the last 30 years.

headline.main: Mapping Three Decades of Global Water Change

byline.original: By Derek Watkins and Henry Fountain

docs.abstract: Koen Olthuis has built more than 200 floating homes and offices, and says the concept is a solution to rising sea levels.
docs.snippet: Koen Olthuis has built more than 200 floating homes and offices, and says the concept is a solution to rising sea levels.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIJSWIJK, The Netherlands — Early next year when a converted cargo container on a floating foundation of plastic bottles opens on the flood-prone shores of Korail Bosti, Bangladesh’s largest slum, few of its users are likely to celebrate the 320-square-foot space as a revolution. Yet, according to Koen Olthuis, the lead architect on the project, it is part of the greatest transformation in urbanism since Elisha Otis built the safety brake that gave rise to the modern elevator, skyscrapers and ultimately urban density.

headline.main: A Dutch Architect Offshores the Future of Housing

docs.abstract: A 75-year-old Buddhist monk was found hacked to death in his temple on Saturday, in a killing that bore similarities to attacks claimed by Islamist extremists.
docs.snippet: A 75-year-old Buddhist monk was found hacked to death in his temple on Saturday, in a killing that bore similarities to attacks claimed by Islamist extremists.
docs.lead_paragraph: COX’S BAZAR, Bangladesh — A Buddhist monk was found hacked to death in his temple on Saturday in a remote region of southeastern Bangladesh. The killing appeared to bear some similarities to recent attacks claimed by Islamist extremists, but the police said it was too soon to determine whether it was another such murder.

headline.main: Buddhist Monk Is Slaughtered at Temple in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Buddhist Monk Is Slaughtered at His Temple in Bangladesh

docs.abstract: A cable by Archer K. Blood, the first ever sent through the State Department’s “dissent channel,” called on Washington to condemn its ally Pakistan’s bloody assault on Dhaka.
docs.snippet: A cable by Archer K. Blood, the first ever sent through the State Department’s “dissent channel,” called on Washington to condemn its ally Pakistan’s bloody assault on Dhaka.
docs.lead_paragraph: On a recent visit to Bangladesh, around the anniversary of its hard-fought war of independence from Pakistan, I conducted an experiment.

headline.main: To U.S. in ’70s, a Dissenting Diplomat. To Bangladesh, ‘a True Friend.’
headline.print_headline: To the U.S. in the ’70s, a Dissenting Diplomat. To Bangladesh, ‘a True Friend.’

docs.abstract: At least 50 people were injured in the latest in a series of industrial disasters over the last several years in Bangladesh.
docs.snippet: At least 50 people were injured in the latest in a series of industrial disasters over the last several years in Bangladesh.
docs.lead_paragraph: TONGI, Bangladesh — A boiler explosion in a cigarette packaging factory outside Dhaka enveloped the five-story building in flames early Saturday, killing at least 23 people, fire officials said.

headline.main: Boiler Explosion at Bangladesh Factory Kills at Least 23
headline.print_headline: 23 Are Dead  in Boiler Blast at a Factory  in Bangladesh

docs.abstract: The government has made great strides in increasing energy capacity. But it needs to give power to the people, too.
docs.snippet: The government has made great strides in increasing energy capacity. But it needs to give power to the people, too.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Dhaka, we are used to the phenomenon called load-shedding. It’s when you’re sitting under the ceiling fan on a particularly hot day, the soles of your feet burning, hoping the evening will bring rain, or at the very least, a slight breeze … and suddenly the world goes quiet, the lights go out, and the fan’s revolutions slow, then stop.

headline.main: A Burst of Energy in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: A Burst of Energy in Bangladesh

docs.abstract: An article in an Islamic State publication bears the byline of Tamim Ahmed Chowdhury, a militant who was killed with two associates in a police raid in late August.
docs.snippet: An article in an Islamic State publication bears the byline of Tamim Ahmed Chowdhury, a militant who was killed with two associates in a police raid in late August.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — An Islamic State publication offered a detailed account of the bloody July 1 siege of a restaurant in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, including the use of religious tests to distinguish Muslims from non-Muslims, who would then be killed.

headline.main: Bangladesh Siege Recalled in Militant’s Words, and From Beyond the Grave
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Siege Is Recalled in a Militant’s Words
